solution_line_template: If the experienced sailors received {more_fraction} times more money than the inexperienced sailors, they were paid {more_fraction}*{inexperienced_hourly} = $<<{more_fraction}*{inexperienced_hourly}={more_per_hour}>>{more_per_hour} more.
The total hourly earnings for the experienced sailors each is ${inexperienced_hourly} + ${more_per_hour}= $<<{inexperienced_hourly}+{more_per_hour}={experienced_hourly}>>{experienced_hourly}
In a {weekly_hours}-hour workweek, an experienced sailor is paid {weekly_hours}*${experienced_hourly} = $<<{weekly_hours}*{experienced_hourly}={weekly_earnings}>>{weekly_earnings}
In a month, an experienced sailor is paid {weeks_per_month}*${weekly_earnings} = $<<{weeks_per_month}*{weekly_earnings}={monthly_earnings}>>{monthly_earnings}
If there were {inexperienced_sailors} inexperienced sailors, the total number of experienced sailors was {total_crew}-{inexperienced_sailors} = {experienced_sailors}

If each experienced sailor was paid ${monthly_earnings} per month, the total combined monthly earnings for the experienced is {experienced_sailors}*{monthly_earnings} = $<<{experienced_sailors}*{monthly_earnings}={total_combined_earnings}>>{total_combined_earnings}
